page.title: 05HOME LIFE
page.content: The householders living in Hallen and the surrounding small farms have one village shop.There is no fresh fish for sale, choice is limited and prices higher than in a supermarket.Life for the elderly and infirm is difficult as the nearest shops at Crow Lane Henbury are 1\miles away, an uphill walk. Westbury village,3 miles away, is on the bus route, return fare is 87p senior citizens receive tokens valued at Â£6 per year to help them with fares. The travelling library calls at Hallen once a month.A number of families have domestic pets and there are kennels for boarding cats and dogs situated on Hallen marsh. School children are bussed long distances for their education.
